alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 2:12PM MST until August 18 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County, Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 209 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Kaibito and Kaibito Creek. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Chaol Canyon, the southern portions of Navajo Canyon, Kaibito and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Starting Water Wash, Square Butte Wash, Navajo Creek, Kaibito Creek, Upper Kaibito Creek, Peach Wash, and Sand Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
